unnormalised: IRCTC announced a summer special train, the "Garmi Express," from Mumbai to Patna, starting 25/04/2024. The train, numbered 12345, will run every Wed until 15/06/2024.
normalised: I-R-C-T-C announced a summer special train, the "Garmi Express," from Mumbai to Patna, starting twenty fifth April two thousand and twenty four. The train, numbered one two three four five, will run every Wednesday until fifteenth June two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Bookings open on 10/04/2024 at 10:00 AM IST. Tickets can be booked via the IRCTC website or app. Passengers are advised to book early due to high demand.
normalised: Bookings open on tenth April two thousand and twenty four at ten zero zero A-M I-S-T. Tickets can be booked via the I-R-C-T-C website or app. Passengers are advised to book early due to high demand.

unnormalised: The Garmi Express has 2 AC coaches, 6 sleeper class, and 4 general compartments. Fares start from Rs. 1500 for sleeper class and Rs. 4000 for AC.
normalised: The Garmi Express has two A-C coaches, six sleeper class, and four general compartments. Fares start from rupees one thousand five hundred for sleeper class and rupees four thousand for A-C.

unnormalised: The train departs CSMT Mumbai at 14:00 hrs and arrives at Patna Jn. at 06:00 hrs the next day, making 10 stops including Prayagraj and Varanasi.
normalised: The train departs C-S-M-T Mumbai at fourteen zero zero hours and arrives at Patna Junction at zero six zero zero hours the next day, making ten stops including Prayagraj and Varanasi.

unnormalised: "We're introducing this train to ease the summer rush," said a senior IRCTC official, Mr. Sharma. "Expect heavy footfall. Passengers travelling to Bihar during peak summer must pre-book tickets well in advance to avoid dissapointment." The railway official warned against touts and assured increased surveillance on the route.
normalised: "We're introducing this train to ease the summer rush," said a senior I-R-C-T-C official, Mister Sharma. "Expect heavy footfall. Passengers travelling to Bihar during peak summer must pre-book tickets well in advance to avoid disappointment." The railway official warned against touts and assured increased surveillance on the route.

unnormalised: Passengers can avail of onboard catering services, with meals priced at Rs. 150 per thali. The pantry car offers a variety of snacks and beverages. Passengers are also allowed to carry their own food on the train.
normalised: Passengers can avail of onboard catering services, with meals priced at rupees one hundred and fifty per thali. The pantry car offers a variety of snacks and beverages. Passengers are also allowed to carry their own food on the train.

unnormalised: IRCTC urges travellers to follow all COVID-19 guidelines during their journey. Wearing masks is compulsory, and passengers are requested to maintain social distancing.
normalised: I-R-C-T-C urges travellers to follow all C-O-V-I-D-nineteen guidelines during their journey. Wearing masks is compulsory, and passengers are requested to maintain social distancing.
